717598f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from 6lst Street. Boulevard, as the present Broadway, north of Columbus Circle was then called, was a favorite street for cyclists, as this picture shows. The Empire Hotel is seen in the centre, on the S.W. corner of 63rd Street.
This will later be rebuilt as a 14-story hotel.
About 1895.
International News.

Wurts Brothers  Oetober 26, 1911

714114f.text:
26-28 West 6lst Street, south side, between Broadway and Columbus Avenue. On the clearing at the left of the picture
a twelve-story garage will be erected.
October 6, 1911
Wurts Brothers, Photographers

714115f.text:
26-28 West 61st Street, south side, between Broadway and Columbus Avenue. On the clearing at the left of the picture
a twelve-story garage will be erected.
October 26, 1911
Wurts Brothers, Photographers

717597f-a.text: Recieved from Cross A Brown Co., March 1958
